prompts.industryType: Analyze '{project_description}' and identify the primary industry (e.g., Technology, Healthcare, Finance, Education, Manufacturing, Retail, Real Estate, etc.). Return only the industry name.
prompts.projectCategory: Based on '{project_description}', determine the project category (e.g., Software Development, Marketing Campaign, Infrastructure, Research, Consulting, etc.). Return only the category.
prompts.u0022: Return ONLY the right curly double quotation mark character: " (Unicode U+0022). No other text, no color codes, no explanations.
prompts.project_goals: Return exactly this text: 'Project Goals' - no punctuation, color codes, or additional text.
prompts.projectOverview: Write a comprehensive project overview for '{project_name}' by {company_name}. Project Description: {project_description}. Structure: (1) One sentence defining what the project is and its core purpose, (2) One sentence on who it's built for and key functionality, (3) One sentence highlighting main benefits and value delivered. Use industry-specific terminology. Focus on streamlining, efficiency, real-time capabilities, and user-friendly aspects where relevant. Write 3-4 flowing sentences (50-65 words total) that showcase the platform's capabilities, target users, and cross-device/platform accessibility. Example style: 'A comprehensive [Type] designed to [purpose]. Built for [users], it ensures [benefits] across [platforms].'
prompts.property1: Generate 2-3 words highlighting a MAJOR BENEFIT of development done by us for '{project_name}'. Style examples: 'Modular by Design', 'Custom-Built Architecture', 'Adaptable Structure'. Output only the words - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.property2: Generate 2-3 words for a DIFFERENT MAJOR BENEFIT that complements property1. Keep it distinct and value-focused. Output only the words - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.property3: Generate 2-3 words for a THIRD MAJOR BENEFIT, distinct from property1 and property2. Output only the words - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.content_1: Write engaging content (2-3 paragraphs, 100-150 words) that explains the core concept, strategic rationale, and primary benefits of {project_name} for {company_name}. Project Description: {project_description}. Structure: (1) What the project is and why it matters, (2) How it works or will be implemented at a high level, (3) Key benefits and value delivered. Use the project description to provide specific, concrete details. Adapt language to project type: technical depth for IT projects, ROI focus for business projects, creative vision for marketing projects, methodology for research projects. Use professional, clear language that resonates with the target audience.
prompts.content_2: Create detailed supporting content (2-3 paragraphs, 100-150 words) that elaborates on the technical approach, methodology, implementation strategy, and execution details of {project_name}. Project Description: {project_description}. Focus on: (1) Technical architecture, tools, or methodologies to be used, (2) Implementation phases or execution approach, (3) Quality assurance, testing, or validation methods, (4) Timeline considerations and delivery milestones. Adjust detail level based on project complexity. Use concrete examples from the project description. Maintain professional tone appropriate to stakeholder technical literacy.
prompts.bullet_1: Create a concise, impactful bullet point (one sentence, 10-15 words) highlighting the MOST IMPORTANT feature or benefit of {project_name}. Based on '{project_description}', identify what delivers the highest value or addresses the most critical need. Focus on outcomes and results, not just features. Use action-oriented language. Start with a strong verb or noun.
prompts.bullet_2: Create a concise bullet point (one sentence, 10-15 words) highlighting a DIFFERENT key feature or benefit of {project_name} that complements bullet_1. From '{project_description}', identify a secondary value driver that addresses a different stakeholder need or business objective. Avoid overlap with bullet_1.
prompts.bullet_3: Create a concise bullet point (one sentence, 10-15 words) highlighting a THIRD key feature or benefit that completes the value proposition of {project_name}. From '{project_description}', identify an additional compelling aspect that addresses implementation, sustainability, scalability, or long-term value. Ensure it's distinct from bullets 1 and 2.
prompts.footer: Create professional footer text for {company_name}'s presentation about {project_name}. Include: company tagline or value statement, confidentiality notice if appropriate, contact information placeholder (e.g., 'For more information, contact [contact]'), and copyright year 2025. Adapt formality to industry standards. Keep to 2-3 lines.
prompts.project: Return exactly the word 'Project' - no additional text or explanations.
prompts.overview: Return exactly the word 'Overview' - no additional text or explanations.
prompts.comprehensive_design_job: Based on {project_category}, return an appropriate equivalent phrase: For design projects: 'Comprehensive design job'; For software: 'Full-stack development initiative'; For marketing: 'Integrated campaign strategy'; For consulting: 'End-to-end advisory engagement'; For construction: 'Complete build project'; Default: 'Comprehensive project scope'. Return only the phrase.
prompts.scope_of_project: Return exactly this text: 'Scope of the project' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.scope_desc: Write a comprehensive scope description for '{project_name}' (40-50 words). Based on '{project_description}', outline: (1) What the project aims to build/deliver, (2) Key features and functionality elements (list 3-4 specific items), (3) Who it empowers/serves (target users), (4) Core benefits (real-time access, intuitive controls, scalability, etc.). Use professional PPT language. Example structure: 'This project aims to build a [type] that [streamlines/provides/enables] [key features]‚Äîempowering [users] with [benefits] and [capabilities].'
prompts.color1: Generate a primary brand color that fits the industry and project tone. For: Tech/Innovation - blues (#2563eb, #3b82f6); Finance/Corporate - navy/teal (#1e40af, #0891b2); Creative/Marketing - vibrant (#8b5cf6, #ec4899); Healthcare - calming blues/greens (#06b6d4, #10b981); Education - warm (#f59e0b, #6366f1); Sustainability - greens (#22c55e, #84cc16). Return only hex code.
prompts.color2: Generate a secondary/accent color that complements color1. Should be in the same color family but darker/lighter or an analogous color. Examples: If color1 is #2563eb, use #1e40af or #1d4ed8. Return only hex code.
prompts.circle_1: Return the same color as color1 for design consistency. Return only hex code.
prompts.circle_2: Return the same color as color2 for design consistency. Return only hex code.
prompts.logo_1: Based on 'Heading_1' concept and '{project_description}', select ONE emoji that MATCHES the goal's theme. Match the concept directly: If about celebration/achievement use üèÜ or üéâ; If about experience use üíª or üì±; If about users/people use üë• or ‚õπüèª; If about growth use üìà or üöÄ; If about strategy use üéØ. Consider: Sports: üèÜ‚öΩüèÖ‚õπüèª; Tech: üíªüì±‚ö°üîß; Business: üìäüíºüéØ; Achievement: üèÜüéñÔ∏èüåü; Experience: üì±üíªüé®. Choose what best represents the Heading_1 goal. Output only emoji.

If about device/mobile use üì±; If about data/analytics use üìä or üìà; If about experience use üíª; If about connectivity use üîó; If about real-time use ‚ö°. Match the specific concept in Heading_2. Output only emoji.
prompts.logo_3: Based on 'Heading_3' concept and '{project_description}', select ONE emoji that MATCHES the goal's theme. If about people/users use üë• or ‚õπüèª; If about onboarding use üìù or üéØ; If about process use ‚öôÔ∏è or üîÑ; If about teams use üë•; If about registration use üìã. Match the specific concept in Heading_3. Output only emoji.
prompts.logo_4: Based on 'Heading_4' concept and '{project_description}', select ONE emoji that MATCHES the goal's theme. If about performance use üìà or ‚ö°; If about architecture use üèóÔ∏è or ‚öôÔ∏è; If about reliability use üõ°Ô∏è or ‚úÖ; If about quality use üåü or üíé; If about infrastructure use üèóÔ∏è. Match the specific concept in Heading_4. Output only emoji.
prompts.logo_5: Based on 'Heading_5' concept and '{project_description}', select ONE emoji that MATCHES the goal's theme. If about automation use ü§ñ or ‚öôÔ∏è; If about intelligence use üß† or üí°; If about innovation use üöÄ or ‚ú®; If about analytics use üìä; If about AI use ü§ñ. Match the specific concept in Heading_5. Output only emoji.
prompts.logo_6: Based on 'Heading_6' concept and '{project_description}', select ONE emoji that MATCHES the goal's theme. If about future use üöÄ or üîÆ; If about growth use üìà or üå±; If about success use üèÜ or üéØ; If about sustainability use ‚ôªÔ∏è or üå±; If about scalability use üìà. Match the specific concept in Heading_6. Output only emoji.
prompts.Heading_1: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a PRIMARY objective. Focus on impact-driven phrases. Examples: 'Celebrate Sporting Spirit', 'Enhance User Experience', 'Streamline Operations', 'Drive Digital Growth'. Use action words or outcome-focused language. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Heading_2: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a SECOND distinct objective, different from Heading_1. Focus on technical or experience aspects. Examples: 'Device-First Experience', 'Seamless Integration', 'Real-Time Insights'. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Heading_3: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a THIRD distinct objective. Focus on user/stakeholder onboarding, engagement, or workflow aspects. Examples: 'Player/Team Onboarding', 'Effortless Registration', 'Simplified Workflow'. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Heading_4: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a FOURTH distinct objective. Focus on performance, scalability, or reliability aspects. Examples: 'Scalable Infrastructure', 'Performance Excellence', 'Robust Architecture'. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Heading_5: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a FIFTH distinct objective. Focus on innovation, automation, or intelligence aspects. Examples: 'Smart Automation', 'Intelligent Analytics', 'Innovation-Driven Design'. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Heading_6: Based on '{project_description}', create a compelling project goal (2-5 words maximum) that captures a SIXTH distinct objective. Focus on growth, future-readiness, or sustainability aspects. Examples: 'Future-Ready Platform', 'Sustainable Growth', 'Long-term Viability'. Output only the goal phrase.
prompts.Head1_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_1', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on creating/building/showcasing specific aspects. Example: 'Create a platform that showcases teams, players and the energy of every match with storytelling'. Be concrete and action-oriented.
prompts.Head2_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_2', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on ensuring/enabling user experience across platforms/devices. Example: 'Ensure smooth navigation and real-time updates across mobile, tablet and desktop'. Be specific and user-focused.
prompts.Head3_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_3', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on allowing/enabling user actions, workflows, or processes. Example: 'Allow teams to register, create rosters and manage schedules without manual intervention'. Be process-oriented.
prompts.Head4_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_4', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on delivering/providing system capabilities, reliability, or performance. Be technical yet clear.
prompts.Head5_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_5', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on implementing/leveraging intelligent features, automation, or innovation. Be forward-thinking.
prompts.Head6_para: Based on '{project_description}' and 'Heading_6', write ONE clear sentence (10-15 words) explaining what we're trying to achieve with this goal. Focus on supporting/enabling growth, scalability, or long-term success. Be strategic.
prompts.side_Heading_1: Based on '{project_description}', generate a PRIMARY feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on the most important technical/functional capability. Use professional naming style with specific descriptors. Examples: 'Multi-Sport Global Navigation', 'Dynamic Scoreboard Logic', 'Unified Payment Gateway', 'Real-Time Data Sync'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_2: Based on '{project_description}', generate a SECOND distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum), different from side_Heading_1. Focus on another core capability or system component. Examples: 'Dynamic Scoreboard Logic', 'Automated Workflow Engine', 'Advanced Search Filter', 'Modular Component System'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_3: Based on '{project_description}', generate a THIRD distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on reusability, component architecture, or system design. Examples: 'Reusable Component Setup', 'Flexible UI Library', 'Modular Architecture', 'Scalable Framework Design'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_4: Based on '{project_description}', generate a FOURTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on performance, reliability, or quality aspects. Use specific technical descriptors. Examples: 'Optimized Performance Engine', 'Robust Data Processing', 'High-Availability System', 'Quality Assurance Framework'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_5: Based on '{project_description}', generate a FIFTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on automation, intelligence, or smart capabilities. Examples: 'Intelligent Automation System', 'Smart Workflow Engine', 'AI-Powered Analytics', 'Adaptive Learning Module'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_6: Based on '{project_description}', generate a SIXTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on integration, API capabilities, or interoperability. Examples: 'API Integration Layer', 'Third-Party Connectivity', 'Flexible Integration Hub', 'Cross-Platform Compatibility'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_7: Based on '{project_description}', generate a SEVENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on security, privacy, or access control. Examples: 'Advanced Security Layer', 'Role-Based Access Control', 'Data Encryption System', 'Privacy Protection Framework'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_8: Based on '{project_description}', generate an EIGHTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on monitoring, maintenance, or support capabilities. Examples: 'Real-Time Monitoring Dashboard', 'Continuous Performance Tracking', 'Automated Health Checks', 'Proactive Maintenance System'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_9: Based on '{project_description}', generate a NINTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on collaboration, communication, or teamwork features. Examples: 'Collaborative Workspace', 'Team Communication Hub', 'Shared Resource Management', 'Multi-User Coordination'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_10: Based on '{project_description}', generate a TENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on customization, configuration, or personalization. Examples: 'Custom Configuration Engine', 'Personalized User Interface', 'Flexible Settings Management', 'Tailored Experience Builder'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_11: Based on '{project_description}', generate an ELEVENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on speed, efficiency, or optimization. Examples: 'Performance Optimization Layer', 'Lightning-Fast Processing', 'Efficient Resource Management', 'Speed Enhancement System'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_12: Based on '{project_description}', generate a TWELFTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on analytics, reporting, or insights. Examples: 'Advanced Analytics Dashboard', 'Real-Time Reporting System', 'Data Insights Engine', 'Intelligent Metrics Tracking'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_13: Based on '{project_description}', generate a THIRTEENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on user interface, UX design, or accessibility. Examples: 'Intuitive Interface Design', 'Responsive UI Framework', 'Accessibility-First Navigation', 'User-Centric Experience'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_14: Based on '{project_description}', generate a FOURTEENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on scalability, growth capabilities, or expansion. Examples: 'Scalable Infrastructure Design', 'Growth-Ready Architecture', 'Elastic Resource Scaling', 'Expandable Platform Framework'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.side_Heading_15: Based on '{project_description}', generate a FIFTEENTH distinct feature name (2-4 words maximum). Focus on innovation, modern technology, or future-ready features. Examples: 'Next-Generation Technology Stack', 'Innovative Solution Architecture', 'Modern Development Framework', 'Future-Proof Design System'. Output only the feature name.
prompts.points_1:
Based on '{project_description}' and the feature '{side_Heading_1}', write EXACTLY 2 points about this feature. Format: First point: Describe what the feature is and how it works in the project context (20-30 words). Second point: Explain the business impact, benefits, or user experience improvements from a different angle (20-30 words). CRITICAL RULE: NEVER include '{side_Heading_1}' or any individual words from '{side_Heading_1}' in your response. Write descriptive content about the feature WITHOUT repeating its name. Example: If heading is 'Secure Payments', do NOT write 'secure' or 'payments' anywhere. Output format:
Feature description and how it works
Business impact and benefits. Dont generate sentence: 'Feature description and how it works' and 'Business impact and benefits'.

prompts.design: Return exactly: 'Design' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.inspiration: Return exactly: 'Inspiration' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.team: Return exactly: 'Team' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.composition: Return exactly: 'Composition' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.our: Return exactly: 'Our' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.process: Return exactly: 'Process' - no color codes or additional text.
prompts.our_process_desc: Write a comprehensive process description (70-85 words) tailored to '{project_name}' and '{project_description}'. Structure: (1) Opening statement about your company's approach (e.g., 'At [company], we follow a structured, collaborative process to bring [project] to life'), (2) List key phases: discovery/research, design, development, QA/testing, (3) Mention alignment with real-world workflows, (4) Closing statement about what the approach ensures (scalability, accuracy, performance), (5) End with final outcome: 'empowering [users] with a seamless [platform type] built for growth, engagement and long-term success.' Use professional PPT language with industry-specific terminology.
prompts.days: Return the number of days along with the word 'days' (e.g., '28 days', '30 days', '45 days')
prompts.what_is_an: Return only the words 'What is an'
prompts.u2200: Return only a double quote character '""'
prompts.p_b: Return only a percentage (e.g., '25%') for Planning budget share based on effort estimation.
prompts.d_b: Return only a percentage (e.g., '35%') for Design budget share based on effort estimation.
prompts.d_v: Return only a percentage (e.g., '20%') for Development budget share based on effort estimation.
prompts.d_p: Return only a percentage (e.g., '20%') for Deployment/Production budget share based on effort estimation.
prompts.conclusion_para: Write a powerful conclusion in professional PPT deck style for '{project_name}' and {company_name}. Based on '{project_description}', follow this structure: (1) Opening statement (40-50 words): 'As we embark on [company]'s journey to build [project], we're excited to unite strategy, technology and a deep understanding of the [domain/ecosystem]. This partnership represents the start of a [adjectives] digital platform built for excellence through its:' (2) Then list EXACTLY 4-5 major outcomes/takeaways as bullet points. Format: Start each with '* ' (asterisk + space), not '-'. Each bullet should be 5-8 words capturing key features/architecture/capabilities. Examples: '* Multi-Sport CMS Architecture' or '* Dynamic Homepage, Fixtures & Results'. Use industry-specific terminology. Total length: 100-120 words including bullets. Ensure bullets directly reflect core project features from description.
prompts.diverse_range_of_users: Return only the words 'Diverse range of users'
prompts.breakup_1: Based on '{project_description}' and {project_category}, identify the PRIMARY target audience segment (2-4 words). Consider who will use/benefit most from this project. Examples: For sports/tournament projects: 'Players & Teams', 'Tournament Organisers', 'Sports Enthusiasts'. For business/commercial: 'Commercial Property Owners', 'Business Clients', 'Enterprise Leaders'. For beauty/wellness: 'Professionals & Industry Experts', 'Beauty & Wellness Brands'. Output only the segment label.
prompts.breakup_2: Based on '{project_description}', identify a SECOND distinct audience segment (2-4 words), different from breakup_1. Focus on another key user group or stakeholder type. Output only the segment label.
prompts.breakup_3: Based on '{project_description}', identify a THIRD distinct audience segment (2-4 words). Focus on secondary users, enthusiasts, or community members. Output only the segment label.
prompts.breakup_4: Based on '{project_description}', identify a FOURTH distinct audience segment (2-4 words). Focus on administrative, support, or operational users. Output only the segment label.
prompts.breakup_5: Based on '{project_description}', identify a FIFTH distinct audience segment (2-4 words). Focus on content consumers, viewers, or passive participants. Output only the segment label.
prompts.breakup_6: Based on '{project_description}', identify a SIXTH distinct audience segment (2-4 words). Focus on partners, sponsors, or external stakeholders. Output only the segment label.
prompts.b1: Return a realistic percentage for PRIMARY audience segment (typically 25-35%). Consider importance and usage volume. Output format: '30%'
prompts.b2: Return a realistic percentage for SECOND audience segment (typically 15-25%). Should be lower than b1. Output format: '20%'
prompts.b3: Return a realistic percentage for THIRD audience segment (typically 10-20%). Should be lower than b2. Output format: '15%'
prompts.b4: Return a realistic percentage for FOURTH audience segment (typically 8-15%). Output format: '12%'
prompts.b5: Return a realistic percentage for FIFTH audience segment (typically 5-12%). Output format: '10%'
prompts.b6: Return a realistic percentage for SIXTH audience segment (typically 5-10%). Ensure all 6 percentages add up to approximately 100%. Output format: '8%'
prompts.p_r_1: Return a PRIMARY resource title (e.g., 'Project Manager', 'UX Designer', 'Frontend Developer') based on '{project_description}' and {project_category}. Output only the job title.
prompts.p_r_2: Return a SECOND PRIMARY resource title, distinct from p_r_1. Examples: 'UX Designer', 'Frontend Developer', 'Technical Lead'. Output only the job title.
prompts.p_r_3: Return a THIRD PRIMARY resource title, distinct from p_r_1 and p_r_2. Output only the job title.
prompts.pr_desc_1: Write a clear responsibility description (8-12 words) for the {p_r_1} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe WHAT this role does and HOW they contribute. Do NOT repeat the exact role title. Use action phrases. Examples: 'Responsible for overall project planning, execution, and coordination' or 'Oversees strategy, timelines and ensures deliverables meet quality standards'. Output only the description.
prompts.pr_desc_2: Write a clear responsibility description (8-12 words) for the {p_r_2} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe WHAT this role does. Focus on design, user experience, or interface aspects if applicable. Example: 'Designs the intuitive and visually appealing user interface (UI) design that is user-friendly'. Output only the description.
prompts.pr_desc_3: Write a clear responsibility description (8-12 words) for the {p_r_3} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe WHAT this role does. Focus on implementation, development, or technical execution. Example: 'Implements responsive design and ensures seamless functionality across all elements of the website'. Output only the description.
prompts.s_r_1: Return a SECONDARY resource title typically needed for '{project_description}'. Common options: 'Backend Developer', 'Software Tester', 'Database Administrator', 'DevOps Engineer'. Choose based on project technical needs. Output only the job title.
prompts.s_r_2: Return a SECOND SECONDARY resource title, distinct from s_r_1. If s_r_1 was 'Backend Developer', choose 'Software Tester' or 'QA Engineer'. If technical project, choose testing/quality roles. Output only the job title.
prompts.s_r_3: Return a THIRD SECONDARY resource title based on '{project_description}' and {project_category}. Choose from support roles: 'Content Writer', 'SEO Specialist', 'Graphic Designer', 'Technical Writer', 'System Administrator'. Match project needs. Output only the job title.
prompts.sr_desc_1: Write a clear support description (8-12 words) for the {s_r_1} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe HOW this role supports the project technically. Focus on backend, infrastructure, or core systems work. Do NOT repeat the role name. Output only the description.
prompts.sr_desc_2: Write a clear support description (8-12 words) for the {s_r_2} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe HOW this role ensures quality, testing, or validation. Focus on QA, testing, or bug fixing work. Do NOT repeat the role name. Output only the description.
prompts.sr_desc_3: Write a clear support description (8-12 words) for the {s_r_3} role in '{project_name}'. Based on '{project_description}', describe HOW this role supports content, design, or auxiliary functions. Do NOT repeat the role name. Output only the description.
